critique: The most likely diagnosis is iron deficiency anemia (Option A). Koilonychia (spoon nails) is a finding associated with iron deficiency anemia and other microcytic anemias. The natural nail convexity is replaced by concave nails. Koilonychia is now infrequently seen because of the widespread use of automated blood counts that identify most patients with anemia before it becomes severe enough to develop this finding.
educational_objective: Identify koilonychia and its association with iron deficiency anemia.
